sanavesa.net

Class ServerClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • sanavesa.net.ServerClient

  • public final class ServerClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The ServerClient class is the client representation on the server side. It contains the essential features required to represent a client on the server.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mohammad Alali
    See Also:
    Server

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The client's own thread to handle incoming and outgoing communication.

      A flag of whether the client is connected.
      private NetworkCommunication networkCommunication
      The communication for the socket.
      private Server server
      The server this client is connected to.
      private java.net.Socket socket
      The client's socket.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerClient

        ServerClient(Server server,
             java.net.Socket socket)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a new client on the server. It is used to represent the client on the server side. This class shouldn't be instantiated manually as it is handled automatically by the library. The Server.onClientConnected(ServerClient) method will be triggered on a successful disconnection.
        Parameters:
        server - - the server the client has connected to
        socket - - the socket of the connected client
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - thrown when the the parameter server or socket is null.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - - thrown when facing issues creating input and output streams for the socket.
        Since:
        1.0

    • Method Detail

      • disconnect

        public final void disconnect()
        Disconnect the client from the server. If already disconnected, the method will terminate early and do nothing. The Server.onClientDisconnected(ServerClient) method will be triggered on a successful disconnection.
        Since:
        1.0

      • disconnect

        final void disconnect(boolean notifyDisconnection)
        Disconnect the client from the server. The parameter notifyDisconnection is used as follows:
        • true - if the disconnection request was made locally.
        • false - if disconnection request was made remotely.
        Parameters:
        notifyDisconnection - - a flag of whether the disconnection request was made locally or remotely
        Since:
        1.0

      • isConnected

        public final boolean isConnected()
        Returns the connection status of the client.
        Returns:
        true if the client is connected to the server; false otherwise
        Since:
        1.0

      • onConnected

        private final void onConnected()
        This method is triggered automatically when the client has successfully connected to the server.
        Since:
        1.0

      • onDisconnected

        private final void onDisconnected()
        This method is triggered automatically when the client has successfully disconnected from the server.
        Since:
        1.0

      • onReceivedData

        private final <T extends NetworkSerializable> void onReceivedData(T data)
        This method is triggered automatically when the server has received data from this client. The data received is a class that implements the NetworkSerializable interface. The data received is handled by the interface via the NetworkSerializable.handleOnServer(Server, ServerClient) method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the data received
        Parameters:
        data - - the data object received from the server
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        NetworkSerializable

      • resetInstance

        private final void resetInstance()
        Used internally to reset the instance's variables. It will terminate the connection and its streams, and stop the communication thread.
        Since:
        1.0

      • run

        final void run()
        The run method handles the incoming networking transmission. This method should never be explicitly called as it automatically handled by the ClientThread class, which calls this method on a separate thread.

        Incoming data will trigger the onReceivedData(NetworkSerializable) method, where the user is able to override and handle the data as he or she wishes.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ClientThread

      • sendData

        public final <T extends NetworkSerializable> void sendData(T data)
        Sends the specified data object to the client.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the data to send
        Parameters:
        data - - the data to send to the server
        Since:
        1.1

      • getConnectionPort

        public int getConnectionPort()

      • getConnectionIP

        public java.lang.String getConnectionIP()
